Question 30                                     
[Computer Organization & Architecture (Instruction Pipelining)]
 
 
Consider a 5-stage pipelined processor with Instruction Fetch (IF). Instruction Decode (ID). Execute (EX). 
 
Memory Access (MEM), and Register Writeback (WB) stages. Which of the following statements about 
 
forwarding is are CORRECT ? 
 
(A) In a pipelined execution, forwarding means the result from a source stage of an earlier instruction is 
 
 
passed on to the destination stage of a later instruction. 
 
(B) In forwarding, data from the output of the MEM stage can be passed on to the input of the EX stage 
 
 
of the next instruction.  
 
(C) Forwarding cannot prevent all pipeline stalls  
 
(D) Forwarding does not require any extra hardware to retrieve the data from the pipeline stages.  
Ans.  (A, B, C)
explanation_text:
Sol.
 
• 
For the load instructions memory data is forwarded to execute state with stall.

PAGE
23

• 
Forwarding can’t prevent all the pipelines stalls.
• 
Buffer is used to hold the intermediate results to performed the data.
Hence, the correct option is (A), (B) and (C).
